=== About Me ===

I have been using Ubuntu since the days of Karmic Koala (9.10). I am also a software engineer and web application developer. Most of my work is in either C++ or Python.

=== Contributions ===

I'm going to do my best to keep this chronological where possible.

* One of the first <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com|Ask Ubuntu]]</nowiki> users (asker of <nowiki>[[http://askubuntu.com/questions/1/how-to-get-the-your-battery-is-broken-message-to-go-away|the first question]]</nowiki>):
   <<BR>>
   {{http://askubuntu.com/users/flair/5.png}}

* Served as <nowiki>[[http://blog.stackoverflow.com/2010/07/moderator-pro-tempore/|moderator pro tempore]]</nowiki> on Ask Ubuntu for roughly 7 months

* Developed <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/stackapplet|StackApplet]]</nowiki>, originally a Gnome panel applet for tracking reputation on Ask Ubuntu. The application was later rewritten to support AppIndicators and <nowiki>[[http://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/stackapplet|packaged in the archives]]</nowiki>

* Built four Juju charms (<nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~charmers/charms/precise/statusnet/trunk|StatusNet]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~charmers/charms/precise/lodgeit/trunk|Lodge It!]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~charmers/charms/precise/stackmobile/trunk|StackMobile]]</nowiki>, and <nowiki>[[https://code.launchpad.net/~charmers/charms/precise/thinkup/trunk|ThinkUp]]</nowiki>)

* Created a <nowiki>[[https://github.com/nathan-osman/gimp-webp|WebP plugin for the Gimp]]</nowiki>, packaged it, and distributed it from <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~george-edison55/+archive/ubuntu/webp|a PPA]]</nowiki>

* Participated in the <nowiki>[[http://davidplanella.org/the-ubuntu-app-showdown-is-starting-today/|first Ubuntu App Showdown]]</nowiki> by developing a cross-platform file transfer application named '''<nowiki>[[https://github.com/nitroshare/nitroshare-desktop|NitroShare]]</nowiki>'''

* Redesigned and maintained the <nowiki>[[http://2buntu.com|2buntu blog]]</nowiki>, an open-source Django-based blogging platform providing tips, tutorials, and up-to-date news on everything Ubuntu.

* Assisted with the creation of the Ubuntu theme for http://discourse.ubuntu.com/

* Published an Ubuntu Touch application for sending WOL (wake-on-LAN) packets to networked devices named '''<nowiki>[[https://github.com/nathan-osman/wakeit|Wake It!]]</nowiki>'''

=== Future Goals ===

Canonical's focus on its mobile operating system (Ubuntu Touch) has opened up many new opportunities for app developers. I have a few ideas for new applications, some of which are still in the planning stages while others are partially complete. Snappy is something I also hope to play around with in the near future.

I am, of course, planning to continue my focus on developing NitroShare on the desktop.
